instruction.en: Press the upper left button, or the little switch in the middle of the module (covered by a plastic cover), EXCACTLY 3 times to activate inclusion mode in the device.
Press the upper left button, or the little switch in the middle of the module (covered by a plastic cover), EXCACTLY 3 times to activate exclusion mode in the device.

Select Pair Mode for the upper two buttons (button #1 and #2).

label.en: In pair mode; left side is on/up, right side is off/down.

hint.en: Select Pair Mode for the lower two buttons (button #3 and #4).

label.en: In pair mode; left side is on/up, right side is off/down

hint.en: This parameter configures which of the buttons that shall control the built-in relay, or if the relay only will be activated for one second, each time button #1 is used.

label.en: Relay is controlled by button #1 or by upper paddle in pair mode. (Default)
Relay is controlled by button #2 or by upper paddle in pair mode.
Relay is controlled by button #3 or by lower paddle in pair mode.
Relay is controlled by button #4 or by lower paddle in pair mode.
Relay is activated for half a second and is controlled by button #1 or by upper paddle in pair mode.
Relay is activated for half a second and is controlled by button #2 or by upper paddle in pair mode.
Relay is activated for half a second and is controlled by button #3 or by lower paddle in pair mode.
Relay is activated for half a second and is controlled by button #4 or by lower paddle in pair mode.
Relay follows the state of button #1; button down => relay is on, button released => relay is off
Relay follows the state of button #2; button down => relay is on, button released => relay is off
Relay follows the state of button #3; button down => relay is on, button released => relay is off
Relay follows the state of button #4; button down => relay is on, button released => relay is off
Relay is only controlled by commands sent to the root device

hint.en: When ZHC5010 receives an Indicator Set message, then the received value can be used only to set the current light level for the actual LED or the level value can be stored and will then be used for subsequent internal LED activations.

label.en: Indicator Set level values are only used to control the LED
Indicator Set level values are also used by internal LED activations. (Default)

hint.en:
Configure the scene sequence numbers that will be transmitted by Central Scene notifications: 
0 == Scene notifications are turned off
Button #1 will send scene [value], button #2 will send scene [value] + 1, button #3 will send scene [value] + 2, button #4 will send scene [value] + 3.
Default = 1
This parameter will enable or disable the so-called "House Cleaning Mode", where ZHC5010 is able to send a dimming command to set the level of the lights to 100%

Decides the time for when a button is detected as long-pressed.
0: Detection disabled. This is not recommended.
 1 - 255: Detection time in 0.01 seconds, 30 equals 0.3 seconds. (Default value is 30)
